p.span: Apache ActiveMQ is a popular and powerful open source message-oriented middleware. Apache ActiveMQ is fast, supports many cross language clients and protocols, comes with easy to use enterprise integration patterns and many advanced features while fully supporting JMS 2.0, AMQP 1.0, MQTT, Stomp and REST.

ul.li: Overall, the project health is very stable. No disgreements in the community and the folks on the project are working together on both ActiveMQ and Artemis. The ActiveMQ code base continues to grow and improve and it is pushing releases more frequently as was the plan. Activity with the Artemis code base continues its successful march toward full compatibility with ActiveMQ.

span.span: Active Discussions around a new web console
The project is a little stuck on the docker issues pending infra and legal

p.span: Support for OASIS AMQP JMS mappings for JMS 1.1 over AMQP 1.0 added
Major refactor of the AMQP implementation making it simpler and easier to understand
-2016-4978] Apache ActiveMQ Artemis: Deserialization of untrusted input vunerability.
Support for setting global limits (total memory and disk utilization) added
Basic Java EE CDI integration added

ul.li: No new PMC members added in the last 3 months
Last PMC addition was Martyn Taylor on Fri Jul 08 2016
John D. Ament was added as a committer on Mon Aug 08 2016
ActiveMQ Artemis 1.4.0 was released on Mon Sep 12 2016

div.p: (Most of this information is pulled from reporter.apache.org)
